questions.question: We ............................... heard anything from them yet.
questions.description: We use have before the third form of the verb.

questions.question: .................................. you think we are doing the right thing?
.................................... you see him yesterday?
questions.description: We use the simple past with past time expressions like yesterday.

questions.question: How long ....................................... it take you to finish a project?
questions.description: Does is used with the first form of the verb has is used with the third form.

questions.question: She ...................................... rung back yet.
questions.description: We use has/have/had with the third form of the verb. The past perfect is totally unnecessary here.

questions.question: .......................................... you call her in the morning?
questions.description: We use did in the simple past.

questions.question: ........................................ you play football when you were young?
questions.description: Did is used with the first form of the verb. Have and had are used with the third form.

questions.question: ..................................... you enjoying this visit?
questions.description: With ing forms we use are/is/am/was/were.

questions.question: .................................. anybody here?
questions.description: Anybody is used with a singular verb.
